intro: Syngonanthus chrysanthus, commonly known as the golden flame or yellow flame plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Syngonanthus chrysanthus prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its vibrant flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value in the garden.
